result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Rosa Varela was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 8/26/2014.

**** 10-2-14 Judge Donald, Court ordered restitution set at $33,604.72 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund. The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remainint due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment *****

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   to be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civi judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.   Take any and all prescribed medications.
No contact with the victim Maria N.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Rosa Varela

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela not in court.  Joshua Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dawn Maldonado appeared for the 10-02-2014 at 2:00 PM Restitution Hearing.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Adam Schleis.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter, Dawn Maldonado appeared to interpret for the defendant.

Spanish Interpreter sworn.
Parties stipulate to an order for restitution in the amount of $33,604.72.
Court ACCEPTS stipulation.

COURT'S RULING:  Court ORDERED restitution set at $33,604.72 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund.    The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Restitution Worksheet as to victim, Maria N., with attached invoice from Froederdt Hospital filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.
for the 10-02-2014 at 2:00 PM Restitution Hearing before Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Adam Schleis appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant, Manuel Rosa Varela, NOT in court.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Parties unable to proceed with a Restitution Hearing today.
Defendant was not produced by the Sheriff's Department, in error.
Defense remains in a contest posture as to the ability to pay $49,000.00.
Parties request an adjournment within 40 days to give the defendant an opportunity to appear.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 10-02-2014 at 2:00 PM for Adjourned Restitution Hearing.
**State to complete an OTP for defendant's appearance on the next court date.
Associated with Charge #1
for the 08-26-2014 at 1:30 PM Restitution Hearing before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter, Enrique Barbosa appeared to interpret for the defendant.

Spanish Interpreter sworn.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Statements made by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 151 DAYS time served.  Court ordered 4 YEARS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 4 YEARS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Maria N.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Take any and all prescribed medications.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution to the victim, Maria N.  (Amount to be determined at an upcoming Restitution Hearing.)
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to 08-26-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Restitution Worksheet from victim, Maria N.
Letter from Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Enrique Barbosa appeared to interpret for the defendant on 07-15-2014.
for the 07-15-2014 at 8:30 AM Sentencing Hearing before Judge Donald's Court.
Brenda Bartholomew appeared for the 05-28-2014 at 1:30 PM Plea Hearing.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter, Brenda Bartholomew, appeared to interpret for the defendant.

Spanish Interpreter sworn.
This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. 

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-15-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

**Court CANCELLED the 06-30-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)
with attached Restitution Worksheet as to victim, Maria N., filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.
for the 05-28-2014 at 1:30 PM Final Pretrial Conference date before Judge Donald's Court.
Sarah Guzman appeared on the 04-14-2014 Bail Hearing date before Judge Donald's Court.

Court MODIFIED bail today and increased bail to $5,000.00 with TURNOVER TO Justice Point with the following conditions in addition to the previous conditions:  (1) No contact with the victim.  (2) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (3) Take all medications as prescribed.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter, Sarah Guzman, appeared to interpret for the defendant.

Matter in court for a competency hearing AND bail/bond hearing.

Spanish Interpreter sworn.

AS TO THE COMPETENCY HEARING:  Defendant is now in a stipulation posture as to the competency report.  No objections.  Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and REINSTATES the proceedings today.  

AS TO STATE'S BAIL MOTION:  State filed a motion to increase bail to $10,000.00 cash.  Defense objects.  Arguments heard.  Court MODIFIED bail today and increased bail to $5,000.00 with TURNOVER TO Justice Point with the following conditions in addition to the previous conditions:  (1) No contact with the victim.  (2) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (3) Take all medications as prescribed.

Defense requests a Final Pretrial Conference date and enters a demand for a "SPEEDY" Jury Trial date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 05-28-2014 at 1:30 PM for Final Pretrial Conference AND 06-30-2014 at 8:30 AM for Speedy Jury Trial.
signed by Atty. Megan Barbara who is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
for the 04-14-2014 at 1:30 PM Competency Hearing before Judge Donald's Court.
Enrique Barbosa appeared on the 03-21-2014 court date before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter for the defendant, Enrique Barbosa, appears in court.

Spanish Interpreter sworn.
Matter in court for return on doctor's competency report.
The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Atty. Steinberg takes no position as to the doctor's report.
Defendant challenges the doctor's report.
Statements made.
Court schedules this matter for a competency hearing.
**Dr. Pankievich to testify on the next court date.
**Court suspends proceedings until the next court date.
Case adjourned to 04-14-2014 at 1:30 PM for Competency Hearing.
as to the defendant prepared by Dr. John Pankiewicz; filed.
for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.
to Increase Bail filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.

Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court, defendant Manuel Rosa Varela not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a scheduling conference/bail bond hearing today, however, new developments prevent the parties from doing so.
Atty. Steinberg raised the issue of competency today.
Statements made.
Court FINDS "probable guilt".
Court SUSPENDS the proceedings today.
Court ORDERS a competency evaluation on the defendant.
Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.
**Court holds State's motion to increase bail in obeyance until the issue of competency is determined.
Case adjourned to 03-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Return on Doctor's Competency Report.
Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court at this time.   Defense requests bail be argued before Judge Donald.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Dawn Maldonado.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maria N.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Manuel Rosa Varela in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
